review_title: Love my bosses but turnover is high
job_title: Life Enrichment Coordinator in Dallas, TX
pros: Co-workers and bosses are amazing

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Dallas, TX
pros: The residents are exceptional and great to serve.
cons: Productivity standards are unrealistic which gets in the way of quality patient care.

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator in Dallas, TX
pros:
Benefit packages were good 
401k match was better than most nursing homes
cons:
No opportunities for growth
Lots of favoritism with senior management 
Department was unorganized 
Retention was awful and turnover was high

job_title: Physical Therapist in Dallas, TX
pros: Good clientele, top notch facility, clean
cons: Micro managing, unrealistic productivity expectations

job_title: Security Officer in Dallas, TX
pros: Pay is not terrible for an entry level security job, getting to know people you work for such as residents is very rewarding.
cons: Some of the people you work with in security are a bit stubborn and difficult to communicate with (in my time there)

job_title: Registered Nurse in Dallas, TX
pros: It was a good place to work in previous management
cons: Laid me off after 20 yrs. no loyalty

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Dallas, TX
pros: The patients and residents become family like.
cons: The productivity standards can sometimes be difficult to meet in such a large campus.

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Dallas, TX
pros: There's many different settings you can work in including skilled nursing, assisted living, or outpatient.
cons: Communication between management and the therapist can be a little hazy.

review_title: Wonderful residents, some great employees, untrustworthy management.
job_title: Dietary Supervisor in Dallas, TX
pros: Mine was a full-time, supervisory position in the food service department. The pay was adequate for a start and benefits were available. I fell in love with the residents, enjoyed my job, and looked forward to the challenges every day. I could have been happy with this location, my position (with hopes of moving upward in management) and expected a long, successful adventure with this company.
cons:
This company had a rigid cap on employees earnings (many employees having worked for years without any hope of a raise) making it impossibly unaffordable for them to take advantage of the benefits package.
Management was unyielding pertaining to common sense issues, making the challenges for more difficult to overcome than necessary - if at all. Most egregiously, corporate considered their written, mandatory policies to be arbitrary.

review_title: A micro managed, low paying, do as I say not as I do company
job_title: Life Enrichment in Dallas, TX
pros: My staff was the best. They worked so hard for an embarrassing amount of pay. Of course the residents were precious but I did not have time to bond with them. A handful of staff were nice and I enjoyed being salary. That's all
cons: I've heard of Micro Managing but I've never seen it done like this. They crushed my spirit. My director was too busy to properly train me but then criticize when the job was not done properly. There's a pyramid of friends running the place and are willing to fire anyone that gets in their way even if it's unscrupulous.

job_title: Physical Therapist Assistant in Dallas, TX
pros: Great co-workers. PVN has a great team of coworkers. I made a lot of lasting friends here. I also feel I grew as a clinician through my experiences here. I feel that I would return to work here with the right circumstances.
cons: Management is not responsive to feedback. They seemed to ask for feedback but not respond to it in a meaningful way which left staff feeling frustrated. Unfortunately this company has grown in to a ‘ machine’  losing a lot of the qualities that made it so great when I began work there in 2012.

job_title: Departmental Supervisor in Dallas, TX
pros: The residents of this retirement community were a blessing to work for and to know.
cons:
While the company praises itself better than the competition it insists on paying its employees based on the same competition. 
The company flaunts its faith-based affiliation, but the hypocrisy is more than evident in how it treats its employees.
Constructs mandatory regulations and procedures but will not abide by them.

job_title: Social Worker Intern in Dallas, TX
pros: Presbyterian Village North really cares about it's residents and go above and beyond to make their stay as comfortable and rewarding as possible.
cons: I really can't think of any down sides of working at Presbyterian Village North

review_title: Great place to work with good values
job_title: LVN Charge Nurse in Dallas, TX
pros: Pay is based on type and years of experience. Good benefits. Family environment. Team work. Management comes in on WEEKENDS and will address issues immediately .
cons: Distance .  Some maintenance issues.

job_title: CNA in Dallas, TX
pros: Some excellent co-workers and some residents are appreciative.
cons: The people in administration do not care about their employees. They never show us any appreciation.  Everything that is done is done for the benefit of their pockets.

review_title: Employees that actually work hard are underpaid and unappreciated.
job_title: in Dallas, TX
pros: Patients were the only reason I worked there as long as I did.
cons: Lazy coworkers; greedy, uninvolved upper management; low pay; no appreciation for good service from employees.
